description: From a Cariban language; compare Galibi Carib urari, Trió urari, wïrari, Akawaio urari, Pemon urari, Macushi urari, referring to various vines of genus Strychnos.

entries.meaning: a plant, Strychnos toxifera, formerly used in arrow poisons in South America due to its D-tubocurarine content
other South American plants with similar toxins that were also used in arrow poisons, mostly in the family Menispermaceae
a substance containing the alkaloid D-tubocurarine, used historically as a muscle relaxant during surgery
